alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 7:51PM MST until January 06 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST /8 AM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow, blowing snow, and northerly wind gusts up to 35 mph, mainly this evening. Total snow accumulations will generally range between 1 and 4 inches, with locally heavier amounts (4 to 8 inches) across portions of Dundy, Hitchcock, and Red Willow counties in Nebraska. Wind chill temperatures as low as 15 to 25 degrees below zero are anticipated across the entire Tri-State area tonight through late Thursday morning. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas, northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, this evening through sunrise Thursday morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, this evening through late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions. Frostbite and hypothermia.
info.instruction: If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. Decelerating abruptly or making sharp turns at a high rate of speed may result in loss of vehicle control. Use caution while traveling outside. Dress in layers, including a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
